page.title: 13ST CATHERINE'S HOSPICE
page.content: The Queen Mother laid the foundation stone of this charitable hospice in 1983. The Duchess of Kent is the patron. It is a modern building in a pleasing design. There are{28 beds plus a certain amount of home care. The patients all have terminal cancer illnesses. They range from 21 to 94 years old. Their average length of stay is about two weeks. During this time, the staff help them to adjust to their new treatment and to face the future cheerfully. There are no waiting lists and no fees to pay. They hope to raise enough money through appeals and donations.{For the {year 1985-6 it will cost Â£530,000 to {run.}Ofthe{64}staff, 40 are full-time. There are also some volunteers. Their cat,{Snoopy,}helps to cheer up the patients and also helps to soothe and comfort them.
